column1:
wouterdb,"2010-06-22T17:09:45.873Z","Average set","
Pro:
- Nice building experience
- New minifigs
- Insite (sick bay): helmet is attached to Anakin with some nice mechanics
- Cockpit
- Moving landing gear

Con:
- View from the left (upper wing)
- Difficult to attach the upper wing and difficult to remove it again (so it is difficult to access the sick bay)
- Medical droid: body has a slight different color than arms and legs
",TRUE,3,4,4,3,3

desire4one,"2010-07-23T10:47:56.383Z","Palpatine's Shuttle Could Use An Upgrade","

This was the first set I put together from the new Star Wars batch.
column2: I was excited, since this was one of my favorite looking ships in all the movies.&nbsp
column3: I tore open the bags, spilled the pieces out and 45 minutes later...I wish I hadn't bought it.&nbsp

column1: The set is pretty complicated one to put together, with lots of non-bricks.
column2: So much time, space and pieces are put into the ""sick bay"", all for a cheesy mechanic that puts Vader's helmet on him and stands him up.&nbsp
column3: Cool!&nbsp
column5: How many times can you recreate that 30 second screen time of Vader's helmet being installed?&nbsp
column6: And thats pretty much the bulk of the shuttles insides.&nbsp
column7: Two small seats will BARELY house minifigs.&nbsp
column8: This isn't a shuttle, its a AMC Gremlin.&nbsp
column9: The overall strength of the assembled ship isn't that good either, with every new placement sure to cause something to fall off.

column1: And it might not be a big deal to most people, but the center wing really bothers me.
column2: It shows pegs-out on the left side and pegholes-out on the right.&nbsp
column3: Lego was getting so good at making stuff appear uniform.&nbsp
column4: Any Lego diehard will notice this right away.

column1: For once though, they finally got the landing gear right.
column2: Two ski's can fold up and down and it makes for a good looking function, and supports the ship nicely.

column1: • Probably the cheapest set these days to get Palpatine
• Clone pilot has a unique face plate, perfectly inbetween Clone Era - Stormtrooper Era

column2: This set should have sold for $40-$45.

column1: • Medical Droid body color doesn't match the color of his limbs.
• Plenty of pieces needlessly used to increase piece count.

column2: Unless Anakin's gonna fight the medical droid...

column1: I already bought the set, so I'm stuck with it, but a word of advice to all buyers.
column2:
Really inspect the outside box pictures and sum up what your going to get out of it - not a whole lot.

",TRUE,2,3,2,2,2

column1: Moscadini,"2010-08-18T19:01:35.79Z","Just a little ""Bigger""","I think money wise, the set is at a good price.&nbsp
column2: I actually thought it was going to be slightly more money.&nbsp
column3: Of course, being said, thought the set was slightly bigger as well.&nbsp
column4: If only the rear chamber was bigger, then it would have been better... like the size of the Imperial Lander.&nbsp
column5:
And to ""open"" the rear, wish it wasn't too complex about it.

Pros:
- 2-1B
- Anakin Skywalker-Darth Vader
- The mode itself and feels very steardy
- Love the landing gear... very creative, wish it could have been used in the same style for the Imperial Shuttle &
column6:
the Imperial Lander

Cons:
- Stickers!!
- As others have mentioned, 2-1B's arms are different color as to the body
- Wished 2-1B was the size of a 3-PO and not as if someone shrunk it's head in the Amazons
- Didn't like much how the Clone Pilot's face/helmet looked like.

Overall, I like the set, has it's ""Quirks"", but that is in almost all the sets anyways.
column7:
Perfect for your Clone Wars collection as well as to your SW Collection.

I give my own overall 3.5/4 out of 5

abertr,"2010-08-24T17:05:02.1Z","I need movie accurate ships...","First off, let me say I am a movie/book/tv purist. &nbsp
column2: This shuttle may very well have been the ship that brought poor burned up Anakin to get re-built to the classic Darth Vadar we all know and love. &nbsp
column3:
However, that transformation didn't take place in this ship, and that is the soul purpose of the interior of this ship is to create the scene were the burned up mini-fig gets transformed...

The ship is very similar in build and style to the Republic attach ship with Mace Windu from 2009.
column4: That is not a bad thing. &nbsp
column5: The top wing is a bit of a disappointment though. &nbsp
column6: The view as seen here shows the ""good"" side of the wing. &nbsp
column7: The other side shows the bottom of the plates. &nbsp
column8:
It is okay, but when you know they could have done better...

I would have liked there to have been a stretcher of some kind that could be stored in the ship.
column9: If it had that, this would be a 5/5 for me. &nbsp
column10: It is okay (a good way to get the Emperor and the new clone pilot), but it is not that great.",TRUE,3,3,3,3,3

Lgodrthnihilius,"2010-08-02T10:12:09.443Z","Palpatines shuttle","

I got this set at toysrus for 50 u.s. dollars. But this set is a good collector's set.It's very worth its money.

The minifigs are great. This is probably the cheapest set ever to get the Palpatine. He is very detailed and has all the right designs.Plus he comes with a lightsaber, not really needed but much apreciated.The clone pilot is an improvement from the last one. The medical droid is also quite cool. The body is one whole piece with the head being part of it. Anakin is this strange tan color. He does not look much different than the old ones besides the color.The body just has part of it burned off and he has this crusty chest that looks very detailed.

One things for sure the darth vader transformation thing is so incomplete. All it does is put the vader helmet on the screwed up anakin.If you take it out you will have a lot of extra space.the lightsaber holder is also pretty bad. And it has these two seats which are very secure for the minifigs.After you take out the vader transformation machine there is tons of room.
Top wing cover:The cover to put minifigs in the ship you have to completely take it off. That is really lame.the top wing is very stable and
column2: i like that. Though very nice the top part stops it from putting many more minifigs than i would like. You have to place them in a straight line. It has a back gun which i think is pointless but still good.

column1: Wings: very detailed but a triangler hole that is huge. easy to cover up though.
Build :horribly annoying. too much technic and fragile stuff.

Overall don't buy this if you are looking to use for space battles , collectors only

starwarsman52,"2010-10-31T21:11:37.023Z","dissapointment :(","I was expecting so much from this set, it let me down. Don't get me wrong, it's a nice set but didn't meet my standards. Looks very nice in flying mode (landing gear up, wings all the way down) but breaks way to easily. The gun turret on the back literally slips off. The cockpit snaps off too easily. Plus opening the main cabin door is like hell. Trying to slip the hooks in takes too much effort, plus by the time you get them in, the wings and cockpit would have been broken already. The minifigs are good though. I wish they would make the burned anakin fig with 1 arm, no legs and a much more bloody and burned face. The medic droid is very detailed. The pilot is great. Plus you get a very rare emperor palpatine (although i wish they would make darth sidious how he looks when he battles Yoda). Don't waste your money on something like this.

  • Pros:
  • SOME nice figs
  • good looking flying mode
  • Cons:
  • crappy build
  • WAY too fragile
  • bad colors

KLOKRIECHER,"2012-03-03T06:28:40.423Z","LEGO Star Wars - Emperor Palpatine's Shuttle Review","

This set is a cool set to have and it's a lot of fun to play with as well.

Box/Instructions

This set has two instruction manuals and there're no mistakes in it.

Parts

This set has a lot of good pieces for future MOC's and/or brickfilms for sure and this set also has 3 numbered bags.

Minifigures

The minifigs we get are really cool. 3 of them are new to this set: Darth Vader, the clone pilot and the medical droid. The droid has some very cool details and I also like the design of the clone pilot. The helmet has a very nice design and the white face looks very cool, too. The torso also has printings on the back. The Darth Vader figure has a torn torso which has a printing on the back and we can also see an angry face on him. The other figure (Emperor Palpatine) is not new but it's the first Palpatine I got so far. He has a gray face with yellow eyes and a black suit. We also get two red light-sabers with this set.

The build

This set will take you a while but it's a lot of fun. We also get two stickers with this set.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8096-1.jpg[/img]


This set has a lot of cool play features. The windscreen can be opened and on each side we can see a turret, which you can sviwel. The wings can be adjusted very easily, too. On the back we can see a nice engine and a turret which can sviwel, too. The top of the shuttle has a nice handle which you can use if you want to maneuver this vehicle. The top can be opened very easily, too and in the inside you can see a place where you can put the mask for Darth Vader on. I also like the landing-gears of this model. I got this set for Christmas last year and I really can't complain about it.
in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get
this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.
Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set

column2:
>Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

",TRUE,4,3,5,4,5

StratTone,"2011-07-08T15:00:44.483Z","My first bad review.","

Man was this set a let down.
column2: The only good about this set is the figures and the neat Darth Vader helmet application.&nbsp
column3: Other than that the wings look terrible once built, the canopy removal is not great, very flimsy feeling, non accurate, poor way to spend $60.&nbsp

column6: The box makes this set look way better than it really is.&nbsp

column1:
Holton,"2011-10-08T23:13:59.52Z","Not a bad addition to the Imperial fleet.","

I tend to focus on building the Imperial navy and as this would essentially have been the (newly appointed) Emperor's first personal craft, it was a must-buy.

Box/Instructions

Nothing major to really comment on here.
column2: The box was big for the amount of bricks - but that is fairly common.&nbsp
column3:
Box art was attractive but it uses the clone trooper header which I personally dislike.

The instructions were divided into two booklets, which seemed a little strange as the build was not too complicated.
column4: That said, they were mostly clear except for the usual trouble discerning between the dark grey and black pieces.&nbsp
column5: There is also a tiny mistake with the lightsaber instructions, but nothing that will confuse.

column1:
Parts

Nothing to get too excited about here, either.
column2: Mostly shades of grey or black - as someone who usually builds Imperial craft, this is to be expected.&nbsp
column3: The cockpit parts are nice and it does include some reddish-brown pieces which I like.&nbsp
column4: There are some Technic parts included for the wing mechanism and the helmet attachment gimmick.

column2: I am very happy to get this version of Palpatine, as the chances of me ever buying the Death Star (10188) are non-existent.
column3: &nbsp
column4: I really liked the burnt Vader figure as well.
column5: He makes a good inclusion to the many faces of Vader and he is much more interesting than the figure that came with the earlier Darth Vader Transformation (7251) set.&nbsp
column6:
The Vader helmet and lightsaber that he comes with are there for the gimmick, though, and really do not look all that good when attached.

The Clone Pilot has a great new head design and makes a nice bridge to the Imperial Pilot from the Imperial V-Wing (7915) set.

2-1B, the medical droid, is also quite a good droid using a similar construction to the common battle droids.
column7: I had no issues with the limbs being a different color to the torso as this seems more realistic and movie-accurate.

column1:
The build

Overall, the build was fairly straight forward.
column2:
It was separated into four build sections - the cockpit, the main body (with transformation gimmick), wings and landing gear and finally the roof.

It took me about three hours in total and I only hit one minor snag.
column3: I misplaced some of the angled pieces on the roof section but this was probably more my impatience than anything else.&nbsp
column4:
As the build is modular it did not take long to spot and fix.

It was mostly enjoyable but, if you are not a fan of Technic (like myself) some of the mechanisms can be a little annoying.

The completed model

I was very satisfied with the finished product.
column5: It looks good sitting on a shelf and is sturdy enough to pick-up and play.&nbsp
column6: I can also appreciate that the transformation gimmick adds to the playability of the set.&nbsp
column7:
Let's be honest - that scene was the best in any of the prequel movies even if it only lasted for thirty seconds.

There are, however, some issues:
column8:
The wings are not mechanically connected so it is impossible to move them at the same time for a take-off or landing.
Even though the slanted parts on the roof are firmly connected they tend to rattle a little when the model is moved.
column9:
In addition, the transformation mechanism has no lock and so the rods at the back of the craft slide in or out whenever the model is held at an angle.
Placing the minifigures usefully in the body of the ship is a little troublesome.
The cockpit has begun to 'droop' a little just a few weeks after being built.

column1:
Summary

I really like the final look of the model and, for the most part, I enjoyed the build - engaging without being too complicated.

I do like my models to be as movie-accurate as Lego allows and, although the model wins on looks (including the holes in the wings - which should be there) the transformation gimmick is obviously inaccurate.
column2:
I would have preferred the inclusion of the other medical droid and/or the automated stretcher that carries Vader to his transformation chamber.

Overall, though, it should appeal to most buyers - it looks good for the collector, with some excellent minifigures but it is also quite playable thanks to the (unfortunately inaccurate) transformation gimmick and general sturdiness.

",TRUE,4,3,4,5,3

Chills,"2012-04-03T13:10:13.14Z","A surpsingly great set","

I bought this set in a lot from eBay and while I thought it would be a cool addition I wasn't expecting to enjoy the set as much as I do.

• Pro 1: The shuttle appears briefly at the end of Ep III, and from what I can tell the Lego designer(s) did a pretty good job creating the set to look like the one from the film. I don't remember gold from the film, but I can hardly fault Lego for adding a splash of color to their set. It doesn't detract from the sinister looking nature of the shuttle
  • Pro 2: The minifigures. You get an Emperor, a clone pilot, an evil-looking 2-1B, and a scarred and burned Anakin. Great additions to a collection.
  • Pro 3: The build was fun, and it took quite a bit of time due to all the small Technic pieces included. But I'd rather have that than a quick and easy build.
  • Pro 4: There is decent playability with this set. The wings fold, there is actual landing gear, the top comes off and there's this cool device that puts Anakin's Vader helmet on and raises his table... just like the movie.
• Con 1: The only negative thing I can think of is 2 stickers that are on the cockpit canopy, it would be nice to have those printed on.

This is a really great set, and well designed. Its solid, has a lot of playability, comes with cool minifigures, and is a fun build. There are a number of little features I didn't mention, so enjoy finding them. Even though this ship isn't one of the ""iconic"" Star Wars ships it is still a nice addition to your collection.

",TRUE,4,4,5,5,4

,TRUE,4,3,4,5,4 alfred_the_buttler","2018-12-14T17:19:17.35Z","Interesting set, but major flaws ","

So I just picked up this set at a garage sale, not because I necessarily wanted it, in fact I knew nothing about it, but because for $25 I figured it was an incredible bargain. Quite honestly, it&rsquo
column2: s worth $25 but I probably wouldn&rsquo
column3: t pay a whole lot more for it.&nbsp

column1: The set has a lot of small parts and then a good amount of larger parts, but what it lacks are average sized parts. The small parts are mostly technic, and I felt like half the set was technic. Beyond that there are a lot of angled plates which I like, but nothing else too unique outside of the few parts that give the cockpit it&rsquo
column2: s shape.&nbsp

are good, the burned Anakin who becomes Vader is fun to have. You get an Emperor, a very interesting pilot in that his head completes the helmet (helmet has a whole and his white head has helmet decorations), and a medical droid. My medical droid has kind of loose legs so seems a bit wobbly, I kind of doubt he was abused because all the other minifigures I got at the garage sale (about 30 of them) are immaculate, so I feel he may have been designed poorly.&nbsp

column1: Like I said, I felt the set was half technic, and since I don&rsquo
column2: t have too much technic I thought it was pretty interesting. It took me about 2.5 hours to completely disassemble and rebuild. There are tons of small parts, but nearly every small part is repeated 20 times so it was always easy to find them. It comes with 2 instruction books, but the majority of the set, including all the complex components, are in the first book. You&rsquo
column3: ll fly through the second book in a few minutes.&nbsp

column1: The model is nice but has some major flaws, most pertaining to playability. It does look like a nice imperial shuttle, and while it may specifically be the emperors, no reason why it couldn&rsquo
column2: t be used to&nbsp
column3: land on Endor&nbsp

column1: The model features very nice retractable landing gear, basically skis. The wings go up and down, however there is nothing in place to stop them from moving when they reach the appropriate height in either direction. They are tight however so they will hold their positions.

the two panels on either side of the top fin are well attached but wiggle due to technic connections that are frictionless and not enough elements around them to hold them in place. Not a huge problem but a little annoying.
There is one major flaw with the design relating to aesthetics
column2: and that is the top fin. One side displays the top of the bricks, and the other displays the bottom and looks ugly. I see no reason why Lego couldn&rsquo
column3: t better design this with a SNOT technique to minimize how much of the brick bottoms you see, it might not be possible to make it perfect, but they didn&rsquo
column4: t even try. The other flaws I&rsquo

column1: This is kind of a mixed bag. The set offers one really cool function. Darth Vader lies down on a bed and it then puts on his helmet and sits him up. This function works very well and is pretty cool. Obviously this is referencing his transformation, but no reason why you couldn&rsquo
column2: t use it to put a helmet on a bathing Vader as well. Of course it is out of place, but I don&rsquo
column3: t mind that since it allows you to avoid having to buy a second set and really just takes place immediately after the shuttle saves him.

column1: However, while this is a cool function, it requires the entire inside of the shuttle, there is no room for anything to be placed in this ship. In fact it is so bad that it elevates the entire floor of the interior so that there is very little headroom in what should be a pretty deep model.
column2: Yes there are two tiny cabins that are sunk down to the bottom and are&nbsp
column3: hard to access and offer zero playability so I suppose they can store minifigures, but I prefer to just stick them onto the outside of the ship because of the next flaw.&nbsp

column1: The next flaw is that the is no way of easily accessing the interior. You have to completely remove the top which requires unlatching three technic made clips. What a pain! Even worse, where do you now place the top? To me this is unacceptable, even in the 80&rsquo
column2: s Lego was designing ships with operable doors that gave you access to the entire interior.&nbsp

column1: It is this last flaw that for me ruins the set. What&rsquo
column2: s the use in a really cool play feature if you can&rsquo
column3: t access it. Was it worth the $25 I paid? Yes. But I wouldn&rsquo
column4: t pay any more than that for this ship. Especially since I feel the piece count is very misleading with all the tiny parts (80 connector pegs alone).

column1:
,TRUE,3,4,5,3,3 BrickFactoryINC","2021-11-16T03:50:29.933Z","The best and only Palpatine's Shuttle","

This set is one of my all-time favorites from the film Revenge of the Sith.
column2: With many imperial shuttles over the years, this is the only one of its kind this shuttle is only in the movie for about a minute, but it is very accurate.&nbsp
column3: The minifig selection is very good with Palpatine, Burned Anakin, medical Droid, and even an exclusive Clone Pilot.&nbsp
column4: The build is very strong it isn&#39
column5: t going to fall apart on you during play and looks good on display.&nbsp
column6: As well the features they had added in such a small space were incredible to allow you to recreate the Vader Transformation easily.

column1: I love this set it is one of the best shuttles built and one of the main pieces of the Revenge of the Sith line of sets.
